He is impressionable. 情绪化的impressionable age 易受影响的年龄give sb. an impression/be under an impression

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from French, from impressionner, from Latin impressio(n-), from the verb imprimere 'press into' (see imprint)

entry.tran: (通常指年轻人)易受影响的,无主见的,无判断力的
entry.def: Someone who is impressionable, usually a young person, is not very critical and is therefore easy to influence.

example.ex: The law is intended to protect young and impressionable viewers.
example.tran: 该法律意图保护那些年轻且无判断力的电视观众。

example.ex: ...seven years old, which is apparently the age at which you are most impressionable.
example.tran: 7 岁,明显是一个最易受人影响的年龄
